metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Go For Loops
The for loop loops through a block of code a specified number of times.
content.html: The for loop loops through a block of code a specified number of times.

content.text: The for loop is the only loop available in Go.
content.html: The for loop is the only loop available in Go.

content.text: Go for Loop
Loops are handy if you want to run the same code over and over again, each time with a different value.
content.html: Loops are handy if you want to run the same code over and over again, each time with a different value.

content.text: Each execution of a loop is called an iteration .
content.html: Each execution of a loop is called an iteration.

content.text: The for loop can take up to three statements:
content.html: The for loop can take up to three statements:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
for  statement1; statement2; statement3 { 
           // code to be executed for each iteration
// code to be executed for each iteration

syntax_highlighting.text:
for  statement1; statement2; statement3 { 
           // code to be executed for each iteration
// code to be executed for each iteration

content.code_html:
for statement1; statement2; statement3 {
   // code to be executed for each iteration
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
for  statement1; statement2; statement3 { 
           // code to be executed for each iteration
// code to be executed for each iteration

content.text: statement1 Initializes the loop counter value.
statement2 Evaluated for each loop iteration. If it evaluates to TRUE, the loop continues. If it evaluates to FALSE, the loop ends.
content.html: statement2 Evaluated for each loop iteration. If it evaluates to TRUE, the loop continues. If it evaluates to FALSE, the loop ends.

content.text: statement3 Increases the loop counter value.
Note: These statements don't need to be present as loops arguments. However, they need to be present in the code in some form.
content.html: Note: These statements don't need to be present as loops arguments. However, they need to be present in the code in some form.

content.text: for Loop Examples

content.code_html:
package main
import ("fmt")

func main() {
  for i:=0; i < 5; i++ {
    fmt.Println(i)
  }
}

content.text: Example 1 explained

content.code_html:
package main
import ("fmt")

func main() {
  for i:=0; i <= 100; i+=10 {
    fmt.Println(i)
  }
}

content.text: Example 2 explained
The continue Statement
The continue statement is used to skip one or more iterations in the loop. It then continues with the next iteration in the loop.
content.html: The continue statement is used to skip one or more iterations in the loop. It then continues with the next iteration in the loop.

content.code_html:
package main
import ("fmt")

func main() {
  for i:=0; i < 5; i++ {
    if i == 3 {
      continue
    }
   fmt.Println(i)
  }
}

content.text: The break Statement
The break statement is used to break/terminate the loop execution.
content.html: The break statement is used to break/terminate the loop execution.

content.code_html:
package main
import ("fmt")

func main() {
  for i:=0; i < 5; i++ {
    if i == 3 {
      break
    }
   fmt.Println(i)
  }
}

content.text: Note: continue and break are usually used with conditions .
Nested Loops
It is possible to place a loop inside another loop.
content.html: It is possible to place a loop inside another loop.

content.text: Here, the "inner loop" will be executed one time for each iteration of the "outer loop":
content.html: Here, the "inner loop" will be executed one time for each iteration of the "outer loop":

content.code_html:
package main
import ("fmt")

func main() {
  adj := [2]string{"big", "tasty"}
  fruits := [3]string{"apple", "orange", "banana"}
  for i:=0; i < len(adj); i++ {
    for j:=0; j < len(fruits); j++ {
      fmt.Println(adj[i],fruits[j])
    }
  }
}

content.text: The Range Keyword
The range keyword is used to more easily iterate through the elements of an array, slice or map. It returns both the index and the value.
content.html: The range keyword is used to more easily iterate through the elements of an array, slice or map. It returns both the index and the value.

content.text: The range keyword is used like this:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
for  index, value := range array|slice|map  {
           // code to be executed for each iteration
// code to be executed for each iteration

syntax_highlighting.text:
for  index, value := range array|slice|map  {
           // code to be executed for each iteration
// code to be executed for each iteration

content.code_html:
for index, value := range array|slice|map {
   // code to be executed for each iteration
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
for  index, value := range array|slice|map  {
           // code to be executed for each iteration
// code to be executed for each iteration

content.code_html:
package main
import ("fmt")

func main() {
  fruits := [3]string{"apple", "orange", "banana"}
  for idx, val := range fruits {
     fmt.Printf("%v\t%v\n", idx, val)
  }
}

content.text: Tip: To only show the value or the index, you can omit the other output using an underscore ( _ ).
content.html: Tip: To only show the value or the index, you can omit the other output using an underscore (_).

content.code_html:
package main
import ("fmt")

func main() {
  fruits := [3]string{"apple", "orange", "banana"}
  for _, val := range fruits {
     fmt.Printf("%v\n", val)
  }
}

package main
import ("fmt")

func main() {
  fruits := [3]string{"apple", "orange", "banana"}

  for idx, _ := range fruits {
     fmt.Printf("%v\n", idx)
  }
}

content.text: Go Exercises
Test Yourself With Exercises
Exercise:
Print i as long as i is less than 6.
content.html: Print i as long as i is less than 6.

content.code_html:
package main   
import ("fmt") 

func main() {
   i:=0; i < 6;  {
    fmt.Println(i)
  }
}

content.text: Start the Exercise
